newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Monday, issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and they are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.
Traders said the market still felt the negative impact of a cut in interest rates by the central bank last Friday.
But trading has become more active in the past few days, with short-term funds flowing out of Shanghai and other major cities to central and western provinces, they said.

The Shanghai Short-term Finance Funding Centre, the market's largest member and a money brokerage run by the central bank, has had surplus money recently because the city's financial institutions were allocated large amounts of money to redeem treasury bonds, which they have not used up, they said.
